intro: Sclerochiton bequaertii, commonly known as the African fireplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking red and orange tubular flowers. The plant has a woody stem and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. It is adapted to arid environments and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant floral display.
